gurmukhi: jwn duKI ApnXo jn kO Apny qn qw kY Cfwie lXo hY ]bkqR iblok bfo vh pMng pY mn BIqr kRu`D BXo hY ]
transliteration: Jaan Doukhiapnyo Jan Kau Apne Tan Taa Kai Chhadaae Layo Hai|| Baktra Bilok Bado Vah Pannag Pai Man Bheetar Kruddh Bhayo Hai||
translation: Seeing all his people in great distress, standing on the bank, Krishna got his body released from the entanglement of the snake; seeing this that dreadful snake got furious;

gurmukhi: sau Pn ko su Plwie aucwiekY swmuih qwih ky Dwie gXo hY ]kUd kY kwnH bcwiekY dwvih aUpir mwQ ju TwFo BXo hY ]213]
transliteration: Sau Phan Ko Su Phalaae Ouchaae-kai Saamuh(i) Taah(i) Ke Dhaae Gado Hai|| Kood Kai Kaahn Bachaae-kai Daavah(i) Oopar(i) Maath Ju Thaadho Bhayo Hai||213||
translation: He again spread his hood, came running inn front of Krishna; Krishna, saving himself from the ambush, jumped and stood with his feet on the forehead of the serpent.213.

gurmukhi: kUdq hY ciV kY isr aUpir sRaun sMbUh clY isr qw qy ]pRwn lgy Cutny jb hI iCn mY n geI aufkY muKrw qy ]
transliteration: Koodat Hai Chad(i) Kai Sir Oopar(i) Sraoun Sanbooh Chalai Sir Taa Te|| Praan Lage Chhin Mai Na Gadudkai Moukhraa Te||
translation: Ascending on the head of that snake, Krishna began to jump and the currents of the hot blood began to flow from the head (of the serpent); when that serpent was about to breathe his last, all the luster of his being ended;

gurmukhi: qaU hir jI bil kY qn ko sr qIr inkws lXo bhu BwNqy ]jwq bfo sh qIr bhXo rs ry bMD KYNcq hY chUM Gwqy ]214]
transliteration: Taoo Har(i) Jibal(i) Tan Ko Sar Teer Nikaas Layo Bahu Bhaante|| Jaat Bado Sah Teer Bahyo Ras Re Bandh Khainchat Hai Chaoon Ghaate||214||
translation: Then Krishna dragged the serpent to the bank of the river with his power; that Naga was pulled towards the bank and on tying ropes from all the four sides, he was dragged out.214.
Speech of the wife of the serpent Kali:

gurmukhi: qau iqh kI iqirXw sB hI suq AMjl jor kY XO iGGXwvY ]r`C kro ieh kI hir jI qum pY brdwn iehY hm pwvY ]
transliteration: Tau Tih Kitiriyaa Sabh Hisout Anjal Jor Kai You Ghighyaavai|| Rachchh Daro Eh Kihar(i) Jitoum Pai Bardaan Ihai Ham Paavai||
translation: Then the wives of the snake, while weeping, said, with folded hands, “O Lord ! grant us the boon of the protection of this snake;

gurmukhi: AMmiRq dyq vhY hm ilAwvq ib`K deI hI hm ilAwvY ]doS nhI hmry piq ko kCu bwq khY Aru sIs JukwvY ]215]
transliteration: Anmrit Det Vahai Ham Liaavat Bikkh Daivah Hiham Liaavai|| Dosh Nahihamre Pat(i) Ko Kachh(u) Baat Kahai Ar(u) Sees Jhoukaavai||215||
translation: “O Lord ! if you give ambrosia to us, we adopt the same and if you give the poison, that also is adopted by us; there is no fault of our husband in this,” saying this much they bowed their heads.215.

gurmukhi: qRws bfo Aih ky irp ko kr Bwig srw miD Awie Cpy Qy ]grbu bfo hmry piq mY Ab jwn hmY hir nwih jpy Qy ]
transliteration: Traas Bado Ah(i) Ke Rip Ko Kar Bhaag(i) Saraa Madh(i) Aae Chhape The|| Gadb(u) Bado Hamre Pat(i) Mai Ab Jaan Hamai Har(i) Naah(i) Jape The||
translation: “We people had great fear of garuda (blue jay) and we had concealed ourselves in this pool; our husband had definitely some pride and he has not remembered the Lord;

gurmukhi: hy jg ky piq hy krunwinD qY ds rwvn sIs kpy Qy ]mUrK bwq jnI n kCU prvwr snY hm ieau hI Kpy Qy ]216]
transliteration: He Jag Ke Pat(i) He Karounaanidh Tai Das Raavan Sees Kape The|| Moondakh Baat Janina Kachhodh Parvaar Sanai Ham Io Hikhape The||216||
translation: “O Lord; our foolish husband did not know that it were you who had chopped all the ten heads of Ravana; we all had destroyed ourselves, our family in vain, on being agitaed.”216.
Speech of Krishna addressed to the family of the serpent Kali:
